meanings.definition: The jargon or specialized language used in the field of education.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the educationese can help parents communicate better with teachers.
meanings.sent2: Teachers often slip into educationese when discussing curriculum changes.
meanings.sent3: The principal's educationese was so confusing that even the teachers were puzzled.
meanings.sent4: To the students, the educationese sounded like a foreign language they couldn't decipher.
meanings.sent5: The educationese of the educational psychologists made the meeting feel like a secret club.

meanings.definition: The style or manner of speaking or writing that is characteristic of educators.
meanings.sent1: Her educationese was so formal that it felt like she was giving a lecture.
meanings.sent2: The educationese used in the staff meeting was full of educational terms and acronyms.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's educationese was so serious that it made the students giggle.
meanings.sent4: In the world of education, speaking educationese is like speaking a different language.
meanings.sent5: The educationese of the professor was so eloquent that it captivated the students' attention.
